Results.name: Wong International Centre
funfacts: The Wong International Centre launched in 1997
The WIC facilities (kitchen, living & dining area, meeting room) are available for use, to all members of the Acadia University Community.

Wong International Centre was launched with the generous support of Gene D. Wong ('49), Acadia’s first graduate of Chinese descent, to provide support and information for Acadia’s many international students.
The Centre offers Wifi, a study room, and a kitchen where you can cook your favourite foods from home. You can also book the Centre to host an event.
Results.address: 27 Acadia Street, Wolfville, NS, Canada, Nova Scotia

Results.name: Vaughan Memorial Library
funfacts: This is Acadia’s main library
The library offers many services, such as group meeting rooms and online support

Opened in 1965, the Vaughan was ‘a dream come true.’ Utilizing the steep slope on which it was built, it also boasted ‘the latest developments in functional library design and layout’ (Acadia Bulletin, December 1965).
The library can accommodate 350,000 volumes and 900 readers throughout its five floors
Acadia's library collection has been housed in the Vaughan Memorial Library since 1965,
Results.address: 50 Acadia Street, Wolfville, Nova Scotia, B4P 2R6

Results.name: Hayward House
funfacts: The academic institution was founded in 1838.
The Hayward House is getting new steps installed!
The Hayward House is right across the street from the BAC

Results.name: Manning Memorial Chapel
funfacts: Bell rings at 11:20 and 11:29 am, and 6:15 pm each weekday to call us to Chapel services.

The university prayer: Lord God of all wisdom, we pray for Acadia University, that she may be faithful to the purposes of our founders, continue to promote the search for truth and knowledge, and be an inspiration to others who follow. May we be a community of scholar's sharing this ambition, caring for one another and loyal to the truth revealed to us by Christ Jesus. Amen

The stained glass windows in the Manning Memorial Chapel present the same pattern to worshippers whether light is behind them or shining upon them. This beauty was the result of careful planning by the master craftsman Henry Lee Willet.
This chapel boasts a 20-stop classical organ that was built by Casavant Freres of Québec, and was dedicated to the University’s War Dead on August 16, 1963.
The church spire, with a six-foot cross covered with gold leaf, towers 198 feet above sea level.
Results.address: Manning Memorial Chapel, 45 Acadia St, Wolfville, NS B4P 2P7

Results.name: Whitman House
funfacts: Whitman House also goes by Tully House!
Whitman is one of eleven residences at Acadia University
Whitman House is the only single gendered residence at Acadia
This is the second oldest residence at Acadia
As of 2019, Tully can house 98 women in single and double rooms, and the building features a main lounge, quiet lounge, two kitchens, two television rooms, and two laundry rooms.

Optimistically, it was planned to be complete for the new school year in the Fall of 1914, but construction fell behind. This did not deter 44 female students from moving into the residence during the first winter despite the ongoing construction.

Results.name: Seminary House
funfacts: Seminary House was founded in 1987
It is a late nineteenth-century, four-storey, wooden structure with Second Empire architectural features.
The Acadia Seminary building is valued for its unique architecture, its association with the history of Acadia University, its association with the history of women’s education at
This building was Designed by Andrew Dewar

Established by progressive Baptist leaders in order to give young women more educational opportunities, the Seminary is the oldest structure in Canada used to house women pursuing post-secondary education.

Results.name: Raymond House
funfacts: It was built in 1927
It was named in honor of Clara Belle Marshall Raymond, the first woman to graduate from Acadia, Class of 1884.
It houses the print shop in the basement and mature students on the top two floors.
Raymond House houses SteamSpace, a program founded in 2013 that teaches students about near horizon technologies, technologies that will start to have an impact in the next two, three or five years,

Results.name: Fountain Commons
funfacts: This building is named after Sheldon L. Fountain
All new students take their ID photos here on their first day on campus!
The Fountain Commons holds many local events.

Results.name: Chipman House
funfacts: The Chipman House is named after Ward Chipman, a Loyalist lawyer and politician who played a significant role in the early history of Nova Scotia.
The house was built in 1829 and has served various purposes over the years.
Well-rounded community that is known for its diversity and inclusivity.
It uniquely features four themed communities designed to help students meet others with similar interests.

The Chipman House is an excellent example of Georgian architecture, characterized by its symmetrical design, brick exterior, and classic detailing. Its historical and architectural significance adds to the charm of Acadia's campus.

Results.name: Beveridge Arts Centre
funfacts: Beveridge Arts Centre offers classes or auditoriums where a wide range of performances take place. This can include theater productions, musical performances, dance recitals, and lectures.
